Title: THE EAWAG BIO-P MODULE FOR ACTIVATED SLUDGE MODEL NO. 3
Authors: L. RIEGER, G. KOCH, M. KÜHNI, W. GUJER and H. SIEGRIST
Abstract: An additional module for the prediction of enhanced biological phosphorus removal is presented on the basis of a calibrated version of ASM3. The module uses modified processes from ASM2d but neglects the fermentation of readily degradable substrate. Biomass decay is modeled in the form of endogenous respiration as in ASM3. Moreover, an additional glycogen pool and biologically induced P-precipitation were not taken into account. The module was systematically calibrated with experimental data from various batch experiments, a full-scale WWTP and a pilot plant treating Swiss municipal waste water. A standard parameter set allowed all data to be simulated. © 2001 Elsevier Science Ltd. All rights reserved
GEMINI_What_problem_does_this_paper_atte: - ASM3 (Activated Sludge Model No. 3) does not include biological phosphorus removal (BPR).\n- Existing models like ASM2d are complex (include fermentation, glycogen pools, etc.) which might be unnecessary for typical diluted municipal wastewater.\n- There is a need for a calibrated, simplified module to predict enhanced biological phosphorus removal (EBPR) that integrates seamlessly with ASM3.
GEMINI_How_the_paper_solves_this_problem:
- Develops the EAWAG Bio-P module as an add-on to ASM3.
- Introduces 4 additional state variables ($S_{PO_4}$, $X_{PAO}$, $X_{PHA}$, $X_{PP}$) and 11 additional processes.
- Simplifies ASM2d by neglecting fermentation of readily degradable substrate and omitting an additional glycogen pool and biologically induced P-precipitation.
- Models biomass decay as endogenous respiration (consistent with ASM3) and uses lower rates for anoxic decay compared to aerobic decay, neglecting anaerobic decay.
- Systematically calibrates the module using an iterative approach with data from batch experiments, a pilot plant, and a full-scale WWTP.
GEMINI_What_experiments_were_done_for_th:
- Batch experiments for PAO decay (aerobic and anaerobic conditions) to study polyphosphate decay and endogenous respiration.
- Batch experiments for P-release and P-uptake (aerobic/anoxic) to calibrate kinetic and stoichiometric parameters.
- Batch experiments examining the grow-in and wash-out of PAO under different flow schemes (DEN, UCT, AAO).
- Full-scale WWTP monitoring (Neugut WWTP) including weekly variations and long-term (9 weeks) simulations.
- Pilot plant monitoring (Tüffenwies) including diurnal variations.
GEMINI_What_are_the_points_that_can_be_e:
- Improving the estimation of initial sludge composition (PP and PHA pools) for short-term dynamic simulations.
- Incorporating dynamic measurements of readily degradable COD ($S_S$) to total COD ratios, rather than using a constant ratio.
- Developing reliable direct measurement methods for internal storage pools like polyphosphate and glycogen to validate the model more accurately.
- Including biologically induced inorganic calcium-phosphate precipitation if applied to different wastewater conditions (e.g., higher pH or temperature).
GEMINI_Summarize_the_main_points_of_the_:
- The EAWAG Bio-P module successfully extends ASM3 to include biological phosphorus removal.
- The module simplifies previous models (like ASM2d) by removing fermentation and glycogen pools, which are shown to be unnecessary for typical Swiss municipal wastewater.
- The model distinguishes between aerobic and anoxic growth/yields and uses endogenous respiration for decay.
- A single standard parameter set was successfully calibrated and validated against various dynamic conditions (batch, diurnal, weekly, long-term) in both pilot and full-scale plants.
GEMINI_What_are_the_relevant_studies:
- Brdjanovic et al. (1998) Impact of excessive aeration on biological phosphorus removal from waste water.
- Carucci et al. (1999) Microbial competition for the organic substrates and its impact on EBPR systems under conditions of changing carbon feed.
- Crocetti et al. (2000) Identification of polyphosphate-accumulating organisms and design of 16S rRNA-directed probes for their detection and quantification.
- Gujer and Larsen (1995) The Implementation of biokinetics and conservation principles in ASIM.
- Henze et al. (2000) Activated Sludge Model No. 3.
- Johansson et al. (1996) Modeling of the anaerobic reactor in a biological phosphate removal process.
- Koch et al. (1998) Final Report: Nitrogen removal in activated sludge plants. Studies at the WWTPs Werdhölzli and Neugut.
- Koch et al. (2000) Calibration and validation of activated sludge model no. 3 for Swiss municipal wastewater.
- Koch et al. (2001) Calibration and validation of an ASM3-based steady state model for activated sludge systems—Part II: Prediction of phosphorus removal.
- Kunst (1991) Investigations of enhanced biological phosphorus removal with regard to waste water treatment.
- Maurer (1996) Enhanced biological phosphorus removal. Modelling of the biological and chemical processes.
- Maurer et al. (1999) Kinetics of biologically induced phosphorus precipitation in waste-water treatment.
- Mino et al. (1995) Modelling glycogen storage and denitrification capability of microorganisms in enhanced biological phosphate removal processes.
- Mino et al. (1998) Review paper: Microbiology and biochemistry of the enhanced biological phosphate removal process.
- Reichert (1998) AQUASIM 2.0—Computer program for the identification and simulation of aquatic systems.
- Satoh et al. (1996) Anaerobic substrate uptake by the enhanced biological phosphorus removal activated sludge treating real sewage.
- Siegrist et al. (1999) Reduction of biomass decay rate under anoxic and anaerobic conditions.
- Smolders et al. (1994) Stoichiometry of the aerobic metabolism.
- Van Veldhuizen et al. (1999) Modeling biological phosphorus and nitrogen removal in a full-scale activated sludge process.
- Wild (1997) Nutrient fluxes in WWTPs with enhanced biological phosphorus removal.
zh_Abstract: 提出了一种基于校准版ASM3的预测强化生物除磷的附加模块。该模块使用了ASM2d中修改过的过程，但忽略了易降解底物的发酵。与ASM3一样，生物量衰减以內源呼吸的形式进行建模。此外，未考虑额外的糖原池和生物诱导的磷沉淀。该模块使用来自各种批次实验、一个全尺寸污水处理厂（WWTP）和一个处理瑞士市政污水的试验工厂的实验数据进行了系统校准。一组标准参数集允许对所有数据进行模拟。 © 2001 Elsevier Science Ltd. 保留所有权利
GEMINI_zh_What_problem_does_this_paper_a: - 活性污泥模型No. 3 (ASM3) 缺乏对生物除磷 (BPR) 过程的描述。\n- 现有的除磷模型（如ASM2d）过于复杂（包含发酵过程、糖原池等），对于典型的低浓度市政污水而言可能是不必要的。\n- 需要一个经过校准的、简化的模块来预测强化生物除磷 (EBPR)，并能与ASM3无缝集成。
GEMINI_zh_How_the_paper_solves_this_prob:
- 开发了“EAWAG Bio-P模块”作为ASM3的附加组件。
- 引入了4个额外的状态变量（$S_{PO_4}$, $X_{PAO}$, $X_{PHA}$, $X_{PP}$）和11个附加过程。
- 对ASM2d进行了简化，忽略了易降解底物的发酵过程，省略了额外的糖原池和生物诱导的无机磷酸钙沉淀。
- 将生物量衰减建模为内源呼吸（与ASM3保持一致），并设定缺氧衰减速率低于好氧衰减速率，同时忽略厌氧衰减。
- 利用批次实验、中试装置和全尺寸污水处理厂的数据，通过迭代方法对模块进行了系统的参数校准。
GEMINI_zh_What_experiments_were_done_for:
- PAO衰减批次实验（好氧和厌氧条件）：研究聚磷的衰减和内源呼吸。
- 释磷和吸磷批次实验（好氧/缺氧）：用于校准动力学和化学计量学参数。
- PAO生长与洗出批次实验：在不同工艺流程（DEN, UCT, AAO）下检查最大释磷量和衰减/生长速率。
- 全尺寸污水处理厂 (Neugut WWTP) 监测：包括周变化数据和长达9周的长期模拟验证。
- 中试装置 (Tüffenwies) 监测：用于模拟和验证日变化动态数据。
GEMINI_zh_What_are_the_points_that_can_b:
- 改进对初始污泥成分（如聚磷PP和PHA池）的估算，以提高短期动态模拟的准确性。
- 引入进水中易降解COD ($S_S$) 与总COD比例的动态测量数据，而非使用恒定比例。
- 开发可靠的直接测量方法来量化内部储存池（如聚磷酸盐和糖原），以便更好地验证模型。
- 如果应用于不同的污水条件（如较高的pH值或温度），需考虑将生物诱导的无机磷酸钙沉淀纳入模型。
GEMINI_zh_Summarize_the_main_points_of_t:
- EAWAG Bio-P模块成功扩展了ASM3，使其具备了模拟生物除磷的能力。
- 该模块简化了以往的模型（如ASM2d），去除了发酵和糖原池过程，证明这些过程在典型的瑞士市政污水条件下是不必要的。
- 模型区分了好氧和缺氧条件下的生长/产率，并采用内源呼吸来描述衰减过程。
- 通过单一的标准参数集，成功在批次实验、中试和全尺寸水厂的各种动态条件（日变化、周变化、长期运行）下完成了模型的校准和验证。
GEMINI_zh_What_are_the_relevant_studies:
- Brdjanovic et al. (1998) Impact of excessive aeration on biological phosphorus removal from waste water.
- Carucci et al. (1999) Microbial competition for the organic substrates and its impact on EBPR systems under conditions of changing carbon feed.
- Crocetti et al. (2000) Identification of polyphosphate-accumulating organisms and design of 16S rRNA-directed probes for their detection and quantification.
- Gujer and Larsen (1995) The Implementation of biokinetics and conservation principles in ASIM.
- Henze et al. (2000) Activated Sludge Model No. 3.
- Johansson et al. (1996) Modeling of the anaerobic reactor in a biological phosphate removal process.
- Koch et al. (1998) Final Report: Nitrogen removal in activated sludge plants. Studies at the WWTPs Werdhölzli and Neugut.
- Koch et al. (2000) Calibration and validation of activated sludge model no. 3 for Swiss municipal wastewater.
- Koch et al. (2001) Calibration and validation of an ASM3-based steady state model for activated sludge systems—Part II: Prediction of phosphorus removal.
- Kunst (1991) Investigations of enhanced biological phosphorus removal with regard to waste water treatment.
- Maurer (1996) Enhanced biological phosphorus removal. Modelling of the biological and chemical processes.
- Maurer et al. (1999) Kinetics of biologically induced phosphorus precipitation in waste-water treatment.
- Mino et al. (1995) Modelling glycogen storage and denitrification capability of microorganisms in enhanced biological phosphate removal processes.
- Mino et al. (1998) Review paper: Microbiology and biochemistry of the enhanced biological phosphate removal process.
- Reichert (1998) AQUASIM 2.0—Computer program for the identification and simulation of aquatic systems.
- Satoh et al. (1996) Anaerobic substrate uptake by the enhanced biological phosphorus removal activated sludge treating real sewage.
- Siegrist et al. (1999) Reduction of biomass decay rate under anoxic and anaerobic conditions.
- Smolders et al. (1994) Stoichiometry of the aerobic metabolism.
- Van Veldhuizen et al. (1999) Modeling biological phosphorus and nitrogen removal in a full-scale activated sludge process.
- Wild (1997) Nutrient fluxes in WWTPs with enhanced biological phosphorus removal.
